About Shelby & Cleveland County, North Carolina
Nestled in the scenic rolling piedmont of southwestern North Carolina, Shelby and Cleveland County offer a welcoming, family-oriented community rich in southern hospitality and small-town charm. Perfectly positioned between Charlotte, Asheville, and Greenville-Spartanburg, the area provides convenient access to urban centers while maintaining a peaceful, close-knit vibe. Residents enjoy a high quality of life with reliable healthcare, low crime rates, and access to Gardner-Webb University, which attracts students worldwide and adds a youthful energy to the area. The four-season climate invites outdoor enthusiasts to explore nearby parks and trails such as the Kings Mountain Gateway Trail, offering hiking, biking, and breathtaking mountain views. Cleveland County embraces a spirit of southern hospitality, where neighbors are friendly and supportive, making it an ideal place for families and individuals seeking a safe and welcoming home. With a strong sense of community spirit, abundant cultural activities, and easy access to both mountain and beach destinations, Shelby and Cleveland County provide the perfect balance of lifestyle, opportunity, and natural beauty.

Charlotte blends big-city opportunity with small-town charm, offering an ideal mix of professional growth and personal comfort. As one of the nation's fastest-growing cities and a major financial hub, it's home to several Fortune 500 companies, world-class hospitals, and soon, a four-year medical school campus from Wake Forest School of Medicine. From the vibrant energy of Uptown to the historic streets of Dilworth or the family-friendly suburbs of Ballantyne and Huntersville, Charlotte's neighborhoods cater to a variety of lifestyles. Enjoy more than 200 parks, greenways, and outdoor attractions like the U.S. National Whitewater Center, plus a full calendar of festivals, concerts, and cultural events throughout the year. Getting around is easy with light rail, extensive bus service, and Charlotte Douglas International Airport nearby. 1814 Westchester Dr Suite #401, High Point, NC 27262

Join Atrium Health Wake Forest Health Network as an Neurology Physician in Winston Salem, NC — part of Advocate Health, one of the largest nonprofit integrated health systems in the country.

Highlights
This is a 100% outpatient care role, with full-time providers working 36 patient-facing hours and 4 administrative hours.
You'll have the advantage of strong and well-established community relationships and excellent administrative support.
Provide general and subspecialty neurology care in an outpatient setting.
Diagnose and manage a broad spectrum of neurological disorders, including MS, epilepsy, stroke, neuromuscular diseases, and more.
Perform neurological evaluations, EMG/NCS, EEG interpretations, and Botox injections (as applicable).
Collaborate with fellow specialists, APPs, and support staff to ensure high-quality patient care.

Graduation from an accredited medical school as an M.D./D.O.
Successful completion of residency and at an accredited healthcare institution.
Current North Carolina Medical Board Medical License as a current M.D./D.O.
Board Certification in Neurology from said residency.
Current American Heart Association or Red Cross Basic Life Support (BLS) required.
Current Drug Enforcement Agency (DEA) and Department of Public Safety (DPS) registration, for prescription writing required.

Known as "North Carolina's International City," High Point is renowned for its semi-annual High Point Furniture Market, which attracts exhibitors and buyers from around the world. The city is a hub for the furniture, textiles, and bus manufacturing industries, contributing to its dynamic economy.
High Point offers a blend of urban amenities and small-town charm, with a variety of neighborhoods, excellent schools, and recreational activities. title: Nocturnist Academic Faculty Physician
description_text:
General Information
Location
Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center
1 Medical Center Blvd
Winston-Salem, North Carolina
Care Delivery Brand
Atrium Health - Wake Forest Baptist
Description & Requirements
AHWFB Department of Medicine, Section on Hospital Medicine is seeking an Academic Nocturnist with training in Internal Medicine to join our dynamic inpatient team at Baptist Medical Center, in Winston-Salem, North Carolina.
Work in a Supportive & Collaborative Environment:
As a Hospitalist within the Wake Forest Baptist Health system, you'll be an integral part of a dedicated healthcare team, collaborating with physicians, nurses, case managers, specialists, and clinical pharmacists to ensure safe and effective patient care during hospital stays. Your role involves admitting patients, closely monitoring patient progress and making necessary treatment adjustments, and engaging in meaningful discussions with patients and their families about their care. Additionally, you'll facilitate seamless communication with the patient's primary care team and provide essential medical records to support their ongoing treatment.
Position Information:
· Full-time, non-tenured faculty position
· Cover night shifts at NC Baptist Medical Center, which is the Flagship Hospital of Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist System in Winston-Salem, North Carolina.
· Primarily admitting responsibilities
· Perform perioperative management and pre-op risk assessments for orthopedic/surgical patients
· Supervision and education of Internal Medicine residents at night
· No ward cross-cover
· Strong support from medical and surgical specialties
· Closed ICU
Highlights
What We Have to Offer:
· CME Reimbursement: $4,500 annually
· Comprehensive Benefits Package: Includes competitive salary, health, dental, vision, retirement plans and more
· Work/Life Balance: Enjoy schedule of 7 days on/7 days off, 12-hour shifts
· Relocation Assistance: Receive up to $10,000 in relocation assistance, paid within the first 30 days of employment
· Schedule Mix: Rotation between Swing (2pm-12am) and Academic Nocturnist 1 &2 (9pm-7am)
Training and/or Experience Required
Requirements:
• Graduate from an accredited Medical School
• BC/BE in Internal Medicine or Family Medicine
• North Carolina licensure or eligible
• Rank commensurate with credentials and experience
Benefits
Paid Time Off programs available for eligible positions
Comprehensive health and welfare benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverage
Retirement benefits, including 401(k) options with employer contributions and access to financial wellness resources
Flexible spending accounts for eligible health care and dependent care expenses
Family support benefits, which may include parental leave, adoption assistance, and surrogacy support
Educational assistance and professional development programs
Paid medical liability insurance
Continuing Medical Education (CME) allowances
Relocation assistance
About Winston-Salem, North Carolina
Winston-Salem beautifully blends rich history with modern innovation, offering residents a vibrant and welcoming community. Known for its picturesque neighborhoods like West End and West Salem, the city features charming historic homes and tree-lined streets. The city boasts a thriving arts and culture scene, with galleries, theaters, music venues, and festivals that bring the community together year-round. Walkable neighborhoods make it easy to explore local shops, parks, and restaurants, supporting an active and healthy lifestyle. Winston-Salem offers a high quality of life with a cost of living below the national average and affordable housing options. It's home to excellent educational institutions such as Wake Forest University, Winston-Salem State University, and Salem College, recognized among the South's best college towns. With over 3,500 acres of parks, 25 miles of greenways, and easy access to both mountains and beaches, Winston-Salem offers abundant outdoor recreation. Above all, residents take pride in their genuine southern hospitality, making it easy to feel at home and build connections in this dynamic and evolving city.

title: Faculty Physician – Pediatric Infectious Diseases- Winston Salem, NC
description_text:
General Information
Location
Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center
1 Medical Center Blvd, Winston-Salem, NC 27157  Winston-Salem, North Carolina
Winston-Salem, North Carolina
Care Delivery Brand
Wake Forest University School of Medicine
Description & Requirements
The Section of Pediatric Infectious Diseases in the Department of Pediatrics at the Wake Forest University School of Medicine (WFUSM) is seeking a full-time faculty member at the rank of Assistant Professor or Associate Professor with passion for clinical excellence and clinical teaching.
Highlights
The successful candidate would have outstanding opportunities to advance in their academic career such as active participation in infection prevention, antimicrobial stewardship, medical education, clinical research, quality improvement, and other areas. Formal mentoring program for junior faculty is available and supported by the institution and department. Section members have a successful record of accomplishments in perinatal HIV prevention, pneumococcal surveillance, vaccine preventable diseases, neonatal infections, global health and medical education.
Clinical Responsibilities:
Providing inpatient and outpatient evaluation and management of children with suspected or proven infectious diseases at Brenner Children’s Hospital in Winston-Salem, NC.
Potential opportunities to expand the ambulatory infectious disease operations.
In addition to clinical responsibilities, the position will also include teaching responsibilities and supervision of medical students and residents.
Additional Highlights:
EPIC EMR
Be part of an integrated nationally recognized organization with physician-led medical group and embedded service line
Leverage access to DAX Copilot, an AI-powered clinical documentation tool integrated with Epic, streamlining clinical workflows by generating draft patient notes for efficient review, editing, and signature
· Experience an environment that provides safe and equitable care for all patients
Training and/or Experience Required
MD, MD/PhD, or equivalent and be board certified or board eligible by the American Board of Pediatrics in the subspecialty of Pediatric Infectious Diseases.
Candidates must have or be eligible for a North Carolina (NC) medical license as determined by the NC Medical Board.
Candidates with a strong interest, training and/or expertise in pediatric infection prevention and/or antimicrobial stewardship are especially encouraged to apply.
Excellent clinical and teaching skills; academic scholarly activities are expected.
New fellowship graduates are welcome to apply.

Macon, Georgia

Description & Requirements
Atrium Health Navicent Medical Group is recruiting for an additional
Cardiothoracic Surgeon
to join our practice located in Macon, Georgia. We are looking for a physician motivated to meet the highest possible standards of care and to partner in providing the best in evidence-based care in a premier and highly respected environment. We are looking for candidates who are forward-thinking with a dedication to excellence.
Atrium Health Navicent is a part of the Advocate Health family, with a combined footprint across 6 states and is the 3
rd
largest non-profit with 67 hospitals. Advocate Health is w
orking to advance health equity and improve access and affordability for the people and communities we serve.
Atrium Health Navicent proudly boasts a Heart and Vascular Center which houses cardiac catheterization labs, dedicated state of the art operating rooms, an EP lab, CVICU, and a cardiac rehabilitation center; all staffed by a dedicated team of highly skilled Cardiac Anesthesiologists, Perfusionists, Physician Assistants, nurses, and support personal. Our Cardiothoracic Surgeons perform a broad range of services including ECMO, thoracic aortic surgery, minimally invasive aortic valve replacement and CABG. Navicent is a certified destination LVAD center and has an active TAVR program that was started in 2017. The thoracic program involves all aspects of thoracic surgery except for transplant.
About Atrium Health Navicent Medical Group:
AHNMG
is an established multispecialty group of 250 + clinicians providing professional medical services to the hospital entities of Atrium Health Navicent, Atrium Health Navicent Baldwin, and Atrium Health Navicent Peach, as well as the patients in the communities we serve. AHWFB Department of Medicine, Section on Hospital Medicine is seeking an Academic Nocturnist with training in Internal Medicine to join our dynamic inpatient team at Baptist Medical Center, in Winston-Salem, North Carolina.
Work in a Supportive & Collaborative Environment:
As a Hospitalist within the Wake Forest Baptist Health system, you'll be an integral part of a dedicated healthcare team, collaborating with physicians, nurses, case managers, specialists, and clinical pharmacists to ensure safe and effective patient care during hospital stays. Your role involves admitting patients, closely monitoring patient progress and making necessary treatment adjustments, and engaging in meaningful discussions with patients and their families about their care. Additionally, you'll facilitate seamless communication with the patient's primary care team and provide essential medical records to support their ongoing treatment.

·         Full-time, non-tenured faculty position
·         Cover night shifts at NC Baptist Medical Center, which is the Flagship Hospital of Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist System in Winston-Salem, North Carolina.

·         Perform perioperative management and pre-op risk assessments for orthopedic/surgical patients
·         Supervision and education of Internal Medicine residents at night
·         No ward cross-cover
·         Strong support from medical and surgical specialties
·         Closed ICU

description_text:

Location

1001 BlytheAv
Charlotte, North Carolina

Description & Requirements
Join Atrium Health as a Pediatric Neurologist in Charlotte, NC—part of Advocate Health, one of the largest nonprofit integrated health systems in the country.
At Advocate Health, we’re committed to being a Best Place to Care—where physicians are empowered, heard, and equipped to do their best work. Atrium Health
Levine Children’s is seeking a General Child Neurologist to join their growing team in Charlotte, North Carolina. The division currently has ten child Neurologists, including four Pediatric Epileptologists, six general Child Neurologists, and five Advanced Practice Providers.
About Levine Children’s Hospital:
With 236 beds, Levine Children’s Hospital (LCH) is the largest children’s hospital between Atlanta and Washington, D.C. It offers a full complement of pediatric subspecialties, including Pediatric Neurosurgery, Pediatric Neuro-oncology, Pediatric Physiatry, Developmental and Behavioral Pediatrics, Pediatric Psychology, and Pediatric Neuropsychology. In addition, the service line houses North Carolina’s only NAEC Level III dedicated Pediatric Epilepsy Monitoring Unit and is the site of the system’s largest pediatric ketogenic diet program. We offer an excellent environment for clinical research and quality improvement work. LCH hosts a premier Pediatrics Residency Program, serves as a teaching hospital for Wake Forest University School of Medicine, and offers excellent support for clinical research and quality improvement.

EEG interpretation not required.

From the vibrant energy of Uptown to the historic streets of Dilworth or the family-friendly suburbs of Ballantyne and Huntersville, Charlotte's neighborhoods cater to a variety of lifestyles. Enjoy more than 200 parks, greenways, and outdoor attractions like the U.S. National Whitewater Center, plus a full calendar of festivals, concerts, and cultural events throughout the year. The Department of Medicine, Section on Hospital Medicine at Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist (AHWFB) is seeking academic-minded, team-oriented Hospitalists trained in Internal Medicine to join our growing and collaborative inpatient faculty at Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center—our flagship academic hospital in Winston-Salem, North Carolina.
Highlights
What We Have to Offer:
•	CME Reimbursement: $4,500 annually
•	Comprehensive Benefits Package: Includes health, dental, vision, life insurance, generous retirement contributions, and more
•	Work/Life Balance: 7-on/7-off schedule to support a sustainable clinical practice
•	Relocation Assistance: Up to $10,000, paid within your first 30 days
•	Schedule Mix: Rotations through teaching teams, rounding, admitting, consult service, and Intermediate Care Unit
•	Career Growth & Stability: Faculty development support in education, quality improvement, leadership, and scholarship
•	Academic Appointment: Full-time, non-tenured position with Wake Forest School of Medicine

About Winston-Salem, North Carolina
Winston-Salem beautifully blends rich history with modern innovation, offering residents a vibrant and welcoming community. Known for its picturesque neighborhoods like West End and West Salem, the city features charming historic homes and tree-lined streets. The city boasts a thriving arts and culture scene, with galleries, theaters, music venues, and festivals that bring the community together year-round. Walkable neighborhoods make it easy to explore local shops, parks, and restaurants, supporting an active and healthy lifestyle. Winston-Salem offers a high quality of life with a cost of living below the national average and affordable housing options. It's home to excellent educational institutions such as Wake Forest University, Winston-Salem State University, and Salem College, recognized among the South's best college towns. With over 3,500 acres of parks, 25 miles of greenways, and easy access to both mountains and beaches, Winston-Salem offers abundant outdoor recreation. Above all, residents take pride in their genuine southern hospitality, making it easy to feel at home and build connections in this dynamic and evolving city.

Advocate Christ has a 37 bed rehab unit providing the full scope of service; you will also do EMGs and consults at Advocate Trinity Hospital

Procedures will include botulinum toxin injections, joint injections, and EMGs
The patient population served is notably diverse, with 35% stroke, brain and spinal cord injury, cardiac/complex medical, complicated joint replacement, some cancer, and other conditions such as trauma, fractures, lower extremity amputations, and general debility

title: Surgical Oncology Physician - Park Ridge, IL
description_text:
General Information
Location
Advocate Lutheran General Hospital
1875 Dempster St, Suite 465
Park Ridge, Illinois
Care Delivery Brand
Advocate Health
Compensation
$507,641 - $507,641
Description & Requirements
Join Advocate Health as a Surgical Oncology Physician in Park Ridge, IL—part of Advocate Health, one of the largest nonprofit integrated health systems in the country.
Position Overview
We are seeking an early career fellowship-trained Surgical Oncologist to join a well-established group of three surgical oncologists practicing across two hospitals. This position offers the opportunity to practice the full breadth of surgical oncology within a collaborative, multispecialty environment, supported by multiple senior partners and robust institutional resources.
Clinical Scope
The incoming surgeon will serve as the primary surgical oncologist for a broad range of complex oncologic cases, including melanoma, sarcoma, combined gynecologic oncology cases, complex gastrointestinal malignancies, endocrine tumors as needed, HIPEC and gastric and esophageal cancers. In addition, the surgeon will provide backup coverage for hepatobiliary, pancreatic, bile duct, adrenal, and liver malignancies, with senior partner support readily available.
Program Development
This role offers a unique opportunity to develop and grow a robotic surgical oncology program, which does not currently exist within the group. The successful candidate will play a key leadership role in shaping minimally invasive and robotic approaches to oncologic surgery, with institutional commitment to program development and growth.
Practice Environment
The surgical oncology group consists of three surgeons with complementary and variable clinical focuses, fostering a collaborative and supportive practice model. Clinical responsibilities are shared across two hospitals, providing a diverse case mix, strong referral base, and opportunities for multidisciplinary collaboration.
This position is ideal for a surgeon seeking a comprehensive oncologic practice, program-building opportunities, and mentorship within a collegial and well-supported surgical oncology team.
At Advocate Health, we’re committed to being a Best Place to Care—where physicians are empowered, heard, and equipped to do their best work. You’ll be part of a leading integrated system with a shared commitment to innovation, well-being, and the communities we serve. Park Ridge is a prime residential community that retains its distinctive, small-town charm where community is a big part of this suburban town. The city's vibrant Uptown shopping area includes the Metra station, Public Library and several parks featuring live musical concerts and special events are held in the summer. title: Medical Director of Molecular Genetics
description_text:
General Information
Location
Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center
Medical Center Blvd
Winston-Salem, North Carolina
Care Delivery Brand
Atrium Health - Wake Forest Baptist
Description & Requirements
The Department of Pathology at Wake Forest University School of Medicine is seeking a Clinical Laboratory Director for Molecular Pathology & Genetics with specialized training in Clinical Cytogenetics, Molecular Genetics & Molecular Oncology to join our growing team at Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist in Winston-Salem, NC.
What We Have to Offer:
Funding to support your continued medical education
Including health, dental, vision, and retirement plans
Flexible scheduling and a supportive work environment
Generous PTO for personal and professional needs
: Support to make your move as seamless as possible.
: Daily interaction and collaboration with colleagues.
Opportunities to advance in education, research, and leadership roles.
Highlights
Responsibilities:
•	Core responsibilities include daily review, interpretation, and documentation of clinical cytogenetic, FISH, chromosomal microarray, and molecular diagnostic test results within established turnaround times.
•	Support a quality management and proficiency program according to written policies and procedures.
•	Provide input for developing new assays and participate in test method selection and validation.
•	Collaborate professionally with laboratory co-directors, technologists, and other laboratory operations staff.
•	Collaborate with clinicians and researchers to provide advanced diagnostic care while supporting cutting-edge research initiatives.
•	Play a vital role in the education of medical students, residents, and fellows.
Training and/or Experience Required
Requirements:
•	PhD or MD degree or equivalent is required
•	ABMGG board certification in Laboratory Genetics and Genomics is required.

•	Outstanding professional credibility and personal integrity.

About Winston-Salem, North Carolina
Winston-Salem beautifully blends rich history with modern innovation, offering residents a vibrant and welcoming community. Known for its picturesque neighborhoods like West End and West Salem, the city features charming historic homes and tree-lined streets. The city boasts a thriving arts and culture scene, with galleries, theaters, music venues, and festivals that bring the community together year-round. Walkable neighborhoods make it easy to explore local shops, parks, and restaurants, supporting an active and healthy lifestyle. Winston-Salem offers a high quality of life with a cost of living below the national average and affordable housing options. It's home to excellent educational institutions such as Wake Forest University, Winston-Salem State University, and Salem College, recognized among the South's best college towns. With over 3,500 acres of parks, 25 miles of greenways, and easy access to both mountains and beaches, Winston-Salem offers abundant outdoor recreation. Above all, residents take pride in their genuine southern hospitality, making it easy to feel at home and build connections in this dynamic and evolving city.

About Milwaukee, WI
Wisconsin’s largest city, urban-easy Milwaukee is a great city on a Great Lake! While still celebrating our beer brewing heritage, the city now has a powerhouse arts scene, big-city attractions, revitalized historic districts, numerous James Beard-nominated chefs and a vibrant farm-to-table culinary scene.
This combination of time-honored tradition and modern attitude is reflected in the architecture and in a variety of walk-around, character-filled neighborhoods. Known as the “City of Festivals,” Milwaukee is home to thirty summer festivals, including Summerfest, the world’s largest music festival which spans 11 days, 11 stages and routinely welcomes more than 800,000 music fans to town. Explore one-of-a-kind attractions like the Milwaukee Art Museum, Miller Park, the world’s only Harley-Davidson Museum and Potawatomi Hotel & Casino and experience a rich brewing heritage on brewery tours offered by MillerCoors and local microbreweries like Lakefront Brewery, Milwaukee Brewing Company and Sprecher.
Milwaukee has an impressive array of public and private schools, including UW-Milwaukee and Marquette University and one of the most convenient and “user-friendly” international airports in the world.

at
Aurora West Allis Medical Center
, 4 miles from Milwaukee and 10 miles from Mitchell International Airport. Hours: 8am to 8am. Rotating holidays and weekends.
Provide on-site, dedicated physician coverage for obstetric patients.
Provide first response to OB urgent situations; manage unexpected obstetrical emergencies such as a obstetrical hemorrhage, prolapsed cord, shoulder dystocia, cesarean hysterectomies and operative deliveries until such time the patient’s attending arrives, or through the course of care as required.
Provide coverage for laboring patients as requested by the attending clinician if the attending clinician is unavailable, cannot get to the hospital, is in the middle of busy office hours, or has scheduled operative cases
Staff the OB Emergency Department in accordance with hospital guidelines
Review all patients on labor and delivery with L&D charge nurse; maintain awareness of status, including labor progress, fetal well-being, and complications of all L&D patients

Provide first response to emergencies on the postpartum unit
Serve as the accepting and admitting physician for transfers of OB patients from other hospitals through the Tertiary Access Program (TAP)
Serve as the admitting team for an unassigned (“no doc”) OB patients
Work collaboratively with the patients’ attending clinicians, residents (when present), maternal fetal medicine physicians, other consultants and nursing staff regarding patients’ plan of care and treatment.
Act as surgical assist for c-sections and cesarean hysterectomies to attending ob/gyn physicians upon request and as availability allows accounting for prioritization of duties to care for the most emergent patients.
Collaborate with all members of the patients’ care team including the patients primary obstetric care provider
Participate in simulations and drills

MD/DO
BC/BE

Highlights
Join the Atrium Health Geriatrics Fellowship
– a one-year, ACGME-accredited clinical training program designed for board-certified or board-eligible physicians in Family Medicine or Internal Medicine who are passionate about advancing their expertise in caring for older adults across the continuum of care.
The anticipated start date is July 7, 2026!
Our fellowship prepares physicians to manage complex geriatric patients in diverse settings, including acute care, long-term care, and ambulatory environments. Fellows gain hands-on experience working collaboratively with an interdisciplinary team of advanced practice providers, nurses, therapists, social workers, dietitians, and other allied health professionals. Clinical rotations span multiple specialties—such as hospice and palliative medicine, neurology, psychiatry, oncology, and physical medicine & rehabilitation—with elective opportunities available to tailor training to individual interests.
In addition to clinical experience, fellows participate in a robust educational curriculum, including weekly core lectures designed to support preparation for the Geriatric Medicine certification exam. Additional learning opportunities include geriatrics-focused conferences and a quarterly interdisciplinary journal club.
Fellows also develop teaching skills through active involvement in family medicine residency education and medical student training, including bedside teaching and formal lectures.
Training and/or Experience Required
Board-Certified or Board-Eligible Family Medicine or Internal Medicine Physician

k.

About Chicago, Illinois
The city center area covers a little more than 4 square miles, lying roughly between Division Street on the north, Lake Michigan on the east, 26th Street on the south and Halsted on the west. The three branches of the Chicago River meet in this area, and the area is considered the city's commercial hub. The area known as the Loop is a section within downtown, surrounded by elevated tracks of the rapid transit network. Many of downtown's commercial, cultural, and financial institutions are located in the Loop. Today, the Loop is also used to identify the larger downtown area.
River North contains the Magnificent Mile, a concentration of high-end retail. The central area is home to Grant and Millennium Parks, skyscrapers, museums, and shopping; and is the site of the city's largest parades: the annual Christmas, Thanksgiving and Saint Patrick's Day parades. You're never far from any activity in this buzzing area, historic architecture, amazing social scene, high culture, and professional sports.

The Pediatric Pulmonary Division at Atrium Health Levine Children's is seeking full-time MD/DO to join their well-established and nationally recognized team.
The Pediatric Pulmonary and Sleep Medicine Division is a thriving group of eight physicians and eight APPs that serve 2 children's hospitals and 4 outpatient locations. Levine Children's is home to Charlotte's only accredited Pediatric Cystic Fibrosis Center and provides multidisciplinary care in the areas of Aerodigestive, Bronchopulmonary Dysplasia, MDA, Severe Asthma, Sickle Cell, Pulmonary Hypertension and Technology Dependence. Applicants should have an interest in the care of complex multidisciplinary patients with pulmonary conditions and demonstrate a commitment to medical education.
About Levine Children's
At 236 beds, Atrium Health Levine Children's Hospital (LCH) is the largest children's hospital between Atlanta and the District of Columbia. It serves high patient acuity as the flagship children's hospital within the innovative Atrium Health and offers a full complement of over 150 pediatric subspecialists in more than 30 different pediatric specialties. LCH has repeatedly been ranked among the Best Children's Hospitals in the nation by
US News & World Report,
most recently in 10 pediatric specialties for 2024-2025 including Pulmonology and Sleep Medicine, Gastroenterology and GI Surgery, Cardiology and Heart Surgery, Neonatology, Urology, Nephrology, Cancer, Neurology and Neurosurgery, Behavioral Health, and Orthopedics. LCH is also ranked as the #1 children's hospital in NC.
LCH hosts a well-regarded Pediatric Residency Program, serves as a teaching hospital for students at the Wake Forest University School of Medicine and offers excellent support for clinical research and quality improvement.
In January 2023, Atrium Health broke ground on a second campus of the school of medicine - Wake Forest University School of Medicine Charlotte - to be constructed in the heart of a new, life sciences research-driven innovation district, named "The Pearl".

Provide direct patient care in both the inpatient and      outpatient settings.
Education of residents and medical students.
Proficiency in performing flexible bronchoscopy.
Interpretation of pulmonary function testing.

About Park Ridge, Illinois
About Park Ridge, Illinois
Park Ridge is a picturesque suburb located 14 miles northwest of downtown Chicago, convenient to O'Hare Airport, major expressways, CTA and Metra trains allowing for an easy commute into the city while enjoying peaceful suburban living.
Park Ridge is a prime residential community that retains its distinctive, small-town charm where “community” is a big part of this suburban town. The city’s vibrant Uptown shopping area includes the Metra station, Public Library and several parks featuring live musical concerts and special events are held in the summer. Throughout the city, quiet tree-lined streets, pleasing architecture, excellent schools, centrally located library and ample parks help make Park Ridge one of the most desirable family communities in the Chicago area. Unique shops and a great selection of restaurants fill the Uptown area, where new buildings blend serenely with historic ones. The Uptown Park Ridge skyline is graced with cupolas, church spires and the 100-foot tower of the Art Deco Pickwick Theatre, which is on the National Register of Historic Places. In addition to the Uptown shopping area, Park Ridge offers other shopping and dining convenient to every neighborhood, including South Park, Village Green, the Dee Park area bordering Oakton Ave. and the Higgins Corridor bordering Chicago. Park Ridge hosts a variety of businesses from privately owned to major corporations and is home to Lutheran General Hospital, a Level 1 trauma center, teaching hospital and part of Advocate Aurora Health.

Mount Airy is a charming city located in Surry County, known for its rich history and vibrant community. Often referred to as "Mayberry," Mount Airy is famously recognized as the inspiration for the fictional town in "The Andy Griffith Show." The city offers a blend of small-town charm and modern amenities, making it an attractive place to live, work, and visit.
Mount Airy boasts a variety of cultural and recreational activities, including annual events like Mayberry Days and attractions such as the Andy Griffith Museum. The city is also home to the world's largest open-face granite quarry, operated by the North Carolina Granite Corporation. With its welcoming atmosphere, scenic beauty, and strong sense of community, Mount Airy is a delightful place to call home.

to join our team at Advocate Children's Hospital in Park Ridge, IL.
Our Division of Genetics at Advocate Children’s Hospital offers a team of genetic specialists to help individuals and families navigate the complex arena of genetics and genomics. Our team of specially trained clinical geneticists and genetic counselors provide a full range of services, including genetic risk assessment, clinical evaluation, genetic testing, and genetic counseling. Our team is committed to the diagnosis, management, and treatment of patients with genetic disorders.
The Division of Genetics offers comprehensive care that extends beyond genetic counseling and diagnosis. description_text:
General Information
Location
Atrium Health Cabarrus
920 N Church St
Concord, North Carolina
Care Delivery Brand
Atrium Health
Description & Requirements
Join Atrium Health as a Urologist in Concord, NC—part of Advocate Health, one of the largest nonprofit integrated health systems in the country.
At Advocate Health, we’re committed to being a Best Place to Care—where physicians are empowered, heard, and equipped to do their best work. You’ll be part of a leading integrated system with a shared commitment to innovation, well-being, and the communities we serve. Whether you're seeking professional growth, meaningful impact, or a team that lifts you up—this is where it starts.
The Atrium Health Department of Urology is part of Atrium Health/Advocate Health, an innovative healthcare organization committed to providing health, hope and healing in our communities. We are a growing academic department, with its own residency and fellowship programs, that provides comprehensive treatment of urologic conditions to patients of all ages. We are committed to Being the Best Place for Care for patients, and the Best Place to Care for our healthcare workforce and teammates.
We are seeking a
BC/BE Urologist
with strong interpersonal skills and a desire to work in a close-knit, community oriented setting to join a team of four new Urologists. We are seeking faculty interested in general urology practice as well as those specializing in urologic oncology, reconstructive urology and/or urogynecology & reconstructive pelvic surgery (URPS). AH Urology Cabarrus is a brand-new practice which is part of our urology faculty program including 18 faculty encompassing the breadth of urologic care and a fully accredited residency program with two residents per year as well as a Urologic Oncology Fellowship. As part of the Department, all faculty will have the opportunity to participate in weekly Urology education conferences, which foster continuous learning, collaboration, and professional growth. Additionally, the Urology Residency Program reflects a strong institutional emphasis on education- creating a rich, academic environment that benefits the entire care team. The interested candidate will have the opportunity to participate in research and education opportunities and specific projects to advance the care of urologic patients across the system. Our leadership structures align community urology faculty with mentors locally and across the region and facilitate pathways to impact positive change.  In addition, the AH Medical Group is renowned for its advanced programs around physician leadership development, physician well-being and career development. Priority will be given to applicants with a strong commitment to resident training.
Highlights
Great relationships with      local physicians – built-in referral system
Shared Call
We offer a competitive      salary and excellent benefits package
Atrium Health Cabarrus is a 457-bed not-for-profit acute-care teaching hospital located in Concord, North Carolina, about 20 miles northeast of Charlotte. It is the only hospital in Cabarrus County, serving as the region’s primary referral center for a population of roughly 618,000 across Cabarrus and surrounding counties.
Atrium Health Cabarrus is also a teaching hospital, hosting the Cabarrus Family Medicine Residency and a sports medicine fellowship, and it houses the Cabarrus College of Health Sciences on its campus.
Atrium Health Cabarrus offers a comprehensive range of medical services, with numerous specialty centers of excellence on site. Key departments and services include emergency/trauma care, cardiology and heart surgery, oncology, women’s and children’s health, neurosciences, orthopedics, and more.

Concord is a vibrant city in Cabarrus County, offering a blend of small-town charm and modern amenities. 15 MFM faculty, six fellows, three genetic counselors, and expert sonographers providing care for high-risk pregnancies.
Our Department
of OBGYN: Includes a generalist division and subspeciality divisions in maternal-fetal medicine, reproductive endocrinology, gynecologic oncology, and gynecologic specialties including faculty members trained in minimally invasive gynecologic surgery and pediatric and adolescent gynecology. The department has an outstanding obstetrics and gynecology residency training program (six residents per year), and fellowship programs in MFM, gynecologic oncology, and female pelvic medicine and reconstructive surgery.

This is a full-time position where you'll provide patient care in the clinic and perform surgeries at Aurora Medical Center – Burlington, as well as at our modern surgical facility, Aurora Southern Lakes.
Your typical week will consist of two days seeing patients in the clinic, two days in the operating room, and one day dedicated to administrative responsibilities.
You’ll handle a broad range of procedures, including general orthopedic surgeries and those specific to your fellowship training.
Clinic hours usually run from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., but may fluctuate based on urgent patient needs or inpatient care requirements.
As this is a new patient panel supporting our growing practice, you can expect to see up to 24 patients per clinic day.
Our facilities offer well-equipped exam rooms and experienced staff, including Registered Nurses (RNs) and Medical Assistants (MAs), with additional support from Advanced Practice Providers (APPs).
APPs manage their own patients and assist with overflow and follow-up care for the physicians.
Both Waterford and Southern Lakes locations are equipped with imaging, laboratory, and therapy services for comprehensive patient care.
You’ll be part of a supportive, collaborative team of physicians and staff.
Call coverage is shared on a 1:4 rotation.

title: Wound Care and Hyperbaric Medicine: Non ACGME Fellowship- Winston Salem, NC
description_text:
General Information
Location
Wake Forest Baptist Medical Center
1 Medical Center Blvd, Winston-Salem, NC 27157
Winston-Salem, North Carolina
Care Delivery Brand
Wake Forest University School of Medicine
Description & Requirements
Wake Forest University School of Medicine is offering a one-year
Fellowship in Wound Care and Hyperbaric Medicine
, beginning
July 1, 2026
. This
non-ACGME
accredited program, housed within the Department of Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery, provides a truly multidisciplinary educational experience. Fellows will gain exposure to a wide range of specialties, including infectious disease, vascular surgery, orthopedics, podiatry, burn care, dermatology, rehabilitation medicine, clinical nutrition, geriatrics, pain management, and rheumatology, while participating in both inpatient and outpatient wound care across four centers. The program also includes rotations in hyperbaric medicine and emphasizes collaboration across disciplines to optimize patient outcomes.
In addition to clinical training, fellows are expected to engage in research, either clinical or laboratory-based, under the guidance of faculty from the Wound Care Center and associated specialties. Competitive applicants must hold an MD or DO degree and be board-eligible or certified by an American Board of Medical Specialties. Physicians from both surgical and medical backgrounds are encouraged to apply. Completion of the fellowship prepares graduates for careers as wound care specialists and potential medical directors. Salary and full benefits are provided.
Highlights
Fellowship Overview
The Wound Care and Hyperbaric Medicine Fellowship is designed to prepare physicians for success in the rapidly evolving field of wound management. Fellows will develop advanced clinical expertise and leadership skills while working within a multidisciplinary team dedicated to limb salvage and comprehensive wound care.
Program Goals
Train physicians to become future leaders in academic and community wound care programs.
Provide a deep understanding of the multidisciplinary approach to wound healing and limb preservation.
Foster the ability to critically evaluate and apply current literature in wound care and hyperbaric medicine.
Our fellowship offers a unique experience within the Department of Plastic Surgery, serving a broad tertiary referral region across western North Carolina, southern Virginia, and southern West Virginia. The program emphasizes collaboration among multiple specialties to deliver exceptional patient care. Wake Forest operates four wound care centers, with each center being committed to a team-based approach and provides comprehensive services, including hyperbaric oxygen therapy (HBOT). This fellowship offers exposure to high-volume clinical practice, advanced wound care technologies, and opportunities for research and scholarly activity.
Training and/or Experience Required
MD or DO degree with completion of an accredited residency program (e.g., Internal Medicine, Family Medicine, Surgery, Emergency Medicine).
Eligible for medical licensure in [State].
Strong interest in wound care, limb salvage, and hyperbaric medicine.

title: Wound Care and Hyperbaric Medicine Physician- Wilkesboro NC
description_text:
General Information
Location
Various Locations
1900 W Park Dr
N. Wilkesboro, North Carolina
Care Delivery Brand
Wake Forest University School of Medicine
Description & Requirements
Join Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist as a Wound Healing and Tissue Repair Plastic Surgery Physician in North Wilkesboro, North Carolina—part of Advocate Health, one of the largest nonprofit integrated health systems in the country.
At Advocate Health, we’re committed to being a Best Place to Care—where physicians are empowered, heard, and equipped to do their best work. You’ll be part of a leading integrated system with a shared commitment to innovation, well-being, and the communities we serve. Whether you're seeking professional growth, meaningful impact, or a team that lifts you up—this is where it starts.
This role focuses on delivering specialized treatment for complex wounds, collaborating with multidisciplinary teams, and ensuring the highest standards of patient safety and clinical outcomes. Your expertise will support our commitment to comprehensive healing and innovation in wound management.
Highlights
Provider Role and Responsibilities:
Clinical Expertise and Compassionate Care
The provider position demands a thorough understanding of clinical wound management, paired with a compassionate approach to patient care. Providers are expected to skillfully assess and evaluate complex wound conditions, utilizing evidence-based practices to guide their interventions. Adapting care plans to suit the unique clinical needs of each patient is essential for optimal healing and recovery. Effective communication and meticulous attention to detail are critical, given the provider’s role in coordinating care across interdisciplinary teams to ensure the consistent delivery of high-quality, patient-centered services.
Commitment to Best Practices and Quality Improvement
Providers are responsible for upholding a high standard of evidence-based clinical practice and compassionate care. This includes remaining current with the latest advances in wound care management, complying with regulatory and institutional guidelines, and actively participating in ongoing quality improvement initiatives. Collaboration and open communication with both healthcare professionals and patients are vital for achieving the best possible outcomes.
Patient Education and Collaboration
Providers educate patients and families on wound care and infection prevention, collaborate with healthcare teams to develop care plans, and document patient progress. They may also write orders, provide specialized wound care, and support complex surgical procedures as needed.
Operational Leadership and Team Collaboration
This role plays a significant part in promoting and communicating operational, quality, and safety goals, standards, initiatives, and improvements within the department. Providers are tasked with identifying barriers to achieving these goals at the unit level of Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist Wound Care Centers and are expected to communicate these issues
to leadership, seeking assistance as needed. Partnerships with nursing leadership and collaboration with other relevant leaders are essential components of the role.
Professionalism and Team Environment
Providers are responsible for leading their teams and setting an example of professionalism and efficiency for everyone they work with. They should create a positive, inclusive workplace by encouraging communication, teamwork, and a spirit of collaboration.
Core Duties
Patient Assessment and Monitoring: Evaluate and monitor wounds of several types, including chronic, acute, surgical, and pressure ulcers.
Treatment and Care Plan Management: Clean and dress wounds, perform debridement, and write orders to promote healing and prevent skin breakdown. Develop and implement individualized care plans.
Patient and Family Education: Provide comprehensive education to patients and caregivers regarding wound care protocols, infection prevention strategies, and overarching healthcare objectives.
Collaboration: Work alongside physicians, nurses, and other healthcare team members to develop and execute care plans.
Documentation: Keep patient records updated and complete for reimbursement.
Resource for Staff: Serve as a source of expertise in wound management, including guidance on appropriate dressing selection and therapies.
Attend relevant education, safety, and compliance meetings.
Identify systemic health and social determinants that interfere with healing and work with other care providers to resolve these issues to aid in wound healing.
Training and/or Experience Required
Requirements: MD or DO, Board Eligible or Certified (US Medical Specialty); Hyperbaric Medicine experience preferred.
NC Medical License
Benefits
Paid Time Off programs available for eligible positions
Comprehensive health and welfare benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverage
Retirement benefits, including 401(k) options with employer contributions and access to financial wellness resources
Flexible spending accounts for eligible health care and dependent care expenses
Family support benefits, which may include parental leave, adoption assistance, and surrogacy support
Educational assistance and professional development programs
Paid medical liability insurance
Continuing Medical Education (CME) allowances
Relocation assistance
About N. Wilkesboro, North Carolina
North Wilkesboro is a charming town located in Wilkes County, nestled in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Known as the "Key to the Blue Ridge," North Wilkesboro boasts a rich history and a vibrant community atmosphere. The town is famously recognized as one of the birthplaces of stock-car racing, with the historic North Wilkesboro Speedway being the first NASCAR-sanctioned track.
North Wilkesboro is also the original home of Lowe's Home Improvement, which continues to have a significant presence in the community. The town offers a blend of small-town charm and modern amenities, with a variety of local businesses, parks, and recreational facilities. Its scenic beauty and welcoming atmosphere make North Wilkesboro an ideal place to live, work, and explore.

Elkin, North Carolina, is a charming town located along the Yadkin River in Surry and Wilkes counties. With a population of around 4,122, Elkin offers a blend of small-town charm and vibrant community life.
Known for its scenic beauty and outdoor activities, Elkin is near Stone Mountain State Park and the Blue Ridge Parkway, providing ample opportunities for hiking and fishing. The town is part of the Yadkin Valley Wine Region, home to numerous vineyards and the annual Yadkin Valley Wine Festival.
Elkin's historic downtown features unique shops, local restaurants, and cultural attractions. Recognized as an official Trail Town, it hosts trails like the Overmountain Victory Trail and the North Carolina Mountains to Sea Trail.

Macon, Georgia, is a vibrant city that blends deep Southern heritage with a growing arts and cultural scene. Known as the "Heart of Georgia", Macon offers a welcoming community with a charming downtown featuring beautifully preserved historic architecture and lively festivals celebrating music, art, and local traditions. Residents enjoy affordable living, with housing costs well below national averages, making Macon an attractive option for families and professionals alike. The city boasts strong healthcare services and quality schools, as well as higher education opportunities with institutions like Mercer University and Middle Georgia State University. Outdoor enthusiasts will appreciate Macon's many parks, trails, and proximity to the Ocmulgee National Monument, offering scenic beauty and recreational activities year-round. Macon provides many opportunities while maintaining a warm, community-oriented atmosphere. : Internal Medicine Physician
Highlights
Duties: The Internal Medicine Physician at Aurora Medical Group, Inc. in Marinette, WI will provide and manage comprehensive primary medical care medical services to adolescent, adult, and elderly patients. Services will include the examination, assessment, diagnosis, non-surgical treatment and management of both common and complex acute and non-acute illnesses and disorders affecting the eyes, ears, skin, bones as well as nervous, reproductive, digestive/excretory, respiratory, circulatory and vascular systems. Will analyze records, reports, test results and/or examination information to diagnose and assess medical condition(s) of patients and then will treat patients by prescribing or administering medication, therapy, vaccination, development programs/activities or other specialized medical care; collect, record and maintain patient medical history; refer patients to medical specialists when necessary; and advise patients concerning wellness and healthy lifestyle, development concerns, activity, disease and injury prevention and mental health.

title: Colorectal Surgeon - Greensboro, NC
description_text:
General Information
Location
Various Locations
3903 N Elm St
Greensboro, North Carolina
Care Delivery Brand
Wake Forest University School of Medicine
Description & Requirements
Join Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist as an Academic Colorectal Surgeon Surgeon in Greensboro, North Carolina—part of Advocate Health, one of the largest nonprofit integrated health systems in the country.
At Advocate Health, we’re committed to being a Best Place to Care—where physicians are empowered, heard, and equipped to do their best work. You’ll be part of a leading integrated system with a shared commitment to innovation, well-being, and the communities we serve. Whether you're seeking professional growth, meaningful impact, or a team that lifts you up—this is where it starts.
The ideal candidate for this position is a mid career surgeon. We are looking for someone who will provide expert surgical care for the spectrum of colorectal diseases in a community setting within the Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist system. This position will largely involve clinical duties in Guilford County (Greensboro and High Point) North Carolina.  There will be facilities for outpatient clinic, outpatient surgery and inpatient surgery. Candidates will need to possess excellent practice building and communication skills and interface with a large variety of referring physicians including primary care doctors, gastroenterologists, and oncologists. The primary practice site will be a multi-specialty office site, staffed by Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist physicians.
Highlights
Clinical Duties (90%)
The candidate should be comfortable with all aspects of the evaluation and management of benign and malignant diseases of the intestines, colon, rectum and anus including minimally invasive approaches of robotic and laparoscopic surgery.  The Candidate should be comfortable with the care of complicated patients in an inpatient setting.
Candidate will develop a broad community practice /colorectal presence at Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist’s (AHWFB) new practice site in Greensboro as well as  AHWFB High Point Medical Center (HPMC).
Candidate will pursue increased market share of colon and rectal surgery within Guilford and Randolph Counties, NC (midstate, west of Durham).  They will assist in marketing the AHWFB Colon and Rectal Surgery Program to community physicians and managed care organizations.  With support of the institution, individual will develop relationships and community outreach to further market penetration as the enterprise expands into previously untargeted communities (i.e. Guilford County).
Participate in a call structure to provide continuous care for our patients, working collaboratively with our Emergency Surgical Services
Ensure high quality, patient centered care in both inpatient and outpatient settings
Teaching and Scholarly Activity (10%)
Candidate will have a desire to teach and train learners and house staff on rotation as part of AHWFB training programs / Wake Forest University School of Medicine.
Colorectal Surgery plays an integral part in the training of our General Surgery Residents as well as 3rd and 4th year Medical Students
Candidate should be equipped and motivated to support and participate in the eventual development of a colorectal surgery fellowship within the Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist system.
Candidate will pursue academic collaborations within the division, institution, and enterprise.
The candidate will be the fifth colorectal surgeon in the AHWFB colon and rectal  practice.  They will lead the colorectal presence in Guilford County.
Candidate will be expected to participate in monthly division meetings, administrative functions and institutional committ
ees as requested
Training and/or Experience Required
MD or DO degree from an accredited medical school.
Completion of an ACGME accredited general surgical residency and colorectal surgery fellowship
Board  Certification or eligibility in colon and rectal surgery by the American Board of Colon and Rectal Surgery  (ABCRS)
Eligibility for unrestricted medical licensure in North Carolina
5-10 years of experience post fellowship
Benefits
Paid Time Off programs available for eligible positions
Comprehensive health and welfare benefits, including medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverage
Retirement benefits, including 401(k) options with employer contributions and access to financial wellness resources
Flexible spending accounts for eligible health care and dependent care expenses

Greensboro is a vibrant city in the heart of the state, known for its rich history, culture, and modern amenities. Home to attractions like the Greensboro Science Center and the International Civil Rights Center & Museum, the city offers a blend of educational and recreational opportunities.
With excellent institutions like the University of North Carolina at Greensboro and North Carolina A&T State University, Greensboro has a dynamic and youthful atmosphere. The historic downtown area features unique shops, local restaurants, and cultural venues, creating a lively hub for residents and visitors.
Outdoor enthusiasts can enjoy numerous parks, trails, and recreational facilities. The city's strong sense of community is evident through its many local events and festivals. Whether exploring historic sites or enjoying the vibrant arts scene, Greensboro, NC, offers a warm and inviting environment for all.

Perfectly positioned between Charlotte, Asheville, and Greenville-Spartanburg, the area provides convenient access to urban centers while maintaining a peaceful, close-knit vibe. Residents enjoy a high quality of life with reliable healthcare, low crime rates, and access to Gardner-Webb University, which attracts students worldwide and adds a youthful energy to the area. Annual salary of $475,000, plus a $25K sign-on bonus

Provide      consultative and co-management MFM care at South Campus and nearby      clinics.
Interpret      and supervise high-risk obstetric ultrasound in AIUM-accredited settings.
Collaborate      closely with OB/GYNs, neonatology, pediatric subspecialists, genetics, and      anesthesia.

Opportunity      to participate in research initiatives if desired
An      academic title through our affiliated Wake Forest University School of      Medicine is also available if desired.

MD/DO,      BC/BE in Maternal–Fetal Medicine.

title: Family Medicine without OB Physician - Wauwatosa, WI
description_text:
General Information
Location
Aurora Health Center
1055 N Mayfair Rd
Wauwatosa, Wisconsin
Care Delivery Brand
Aurora Health Care
Compensation
$316,746 - $316,746
Description & Requirements
Join one of the nation’s largest, most respected health systems and experience what it means to live well. Advocate Health is seeking a Family Medicine physician to join our physician-led medical group and serve its patients at Aurora Health Center - Mayfair South in Wauwatosa, WI.
Highlights
Mayfair South – 1055 North Mayfair Road
•
Reason for opening – growth
•
The patient panel will be grown, but the partners at the site are at the 75th – 90th percentile for production. Building a panel will not be hard.
•
Currently 5 site partners, adding a 6th.
•
The site prefers a 4-day work week and has Tuesday to Friday schedule with Monday’s off
•
The site is open from 7:20 to 5 pm, the clinician can work to create a schedule in this time to also meet the 36 patient contact hours.  100 hours extended hours per year are expected (before 8 am or during the 12 – 1 lunch hour)
•
Call ratio is 1:6 with the addition of the new team member.  The call is managed by the nurse triage line where 85% of the calls are resolved without involving the physician on call.
•
What are the specialties at the site - Within the building there is Allergy, Cardiology, Endo, Oncology, Nero, Ortho (down the street) and Anti Coagulation.
•
The site has a pharmacy dispensary, a lab on site for rapid. Draws can be done and sent out daily.   Imaging is on site for CT, Nuc, general diagnostic.
•
The physician partner will have a shared office and will have 2 exam rooms per physician. They can do procedures and there is a shared procedure room
•
The physician will have their own MA. There is a shared RN that works with every 2-3 physicians responsible for nurse triage at the site. The site does not have APC and don’t plan to add.
What makes this site great or unique compared to other sites? – This site is very collaborative site, with a great patient panel. A mix of suburban patients from Elm Grove, Brookfield and Wauwatosa, but also on Milwaukee’s bus line offering an urban and working-class patient panel.  The site also has a great mix of LGBTQ+ patients and a physician interested in a diverse patient panel.  The location is in a great area with lots of activity.
What are some of the struggles we face to be up front with the candidate? – While this is a great site, the land lock in the area limits the schedule a bit, only allowing for a 4-day work week from Tuesday to Friday.  There will be a shared office space and only 2 exam rooms most days. If physician partners are okay with this, the site will be very attractive for most candidates.
What does the patient demographic look like? – The patient panel will have a unique diversity of payor mix, ethnicity and supports physicians to build a panel that meets their practice preferences, including women’s health, LGBTQ+ and all age ranges.
The team dynamic is great, and they are a very collaborate group. The physician partners tend to be a younger, new physician team that supports and open-door policy.
Training and/or Experience Required
The opening is due to a replacement.
Current partners are high producers, so building a patient panel should be easy.
The team prefers a 4-day work week
Clinic hours are 7:20 AM–5 PM, and schedules are flexible to meet 36 patient contact hours plus 100 extended hours annually.
Call is 1:6, mostly handled by nurse triage (85% resolved without physician involvement).
Onsite specialties include Allergy, Cardiology, Endocrinology, Oncology, Neurology, Anticoagulation, and nearby Orthopedics.
The site has a pharmacy, lab for rapid tests and daily draws, and imaging (CT, nuclear, general).
Physicians share office space, have 2 exam rooms, access to a procedure room, a dedicated MA, and a shared RN (2–3 physicians per RN). No APCs.
The team is collaborative and supports an open-door culture.

description_text:
General Information
Location
Advocate Lutheran General Hospital
1775 Dempster St, Park Ridge, IL 60068
Park Ridge, Illinois
Care Delivery Brand
Advocate Health Care
Compensation
$432,961 -$432.961 , plus additional incentive and  sign-on bonus eligible
Description & Requirements
Join Advocate Health as the General Surgery Residency Program Director and trauma surgeon in Park Ridge, IL —part of Advocate Health, one of the largest nonprofit integrated health systems in the country.
At Advocate Health, we’re committed to being a Best Place to Care—where physicians are empowered, heard, and equipped to do their best work. You’ll be part of a leading integrated system with a shared commitment to innovation, well-being, and the communities we serve. Whether you're seeking professional growth, meaningful impact, or a team that lifts you up—this is where it starts.
We are seeking a skilled trauma surgeon to join our medical education team as the Program Director for our General Surgery Residency Program. As the Program Director, you will play a crucial role in leading and overseeing our General Surgery Residency program at Advocate Lutheran General Hospital and Advocate Christ Medical Center, both in the Chicagoland area. You will also provide clinical services as a trauma surgeon at our busy Level I center.  Your expertise and guidance will be instrumental in shaping the future of our program and supporting the development of aspiring surgeons.
This is a full-time position with .5 FTE dedicated to the Program Director role, and .5 FTE for your clinical work as a trauma/surgical critical care surgeon.
Highlights
RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, implement, and maintain a comprehensive curriculum that meets ACGME requirements and prepares residents for independent surgical practice.
Oversee the recruitment, selection, and onboarding of new residents.
Conduct regular evaluations of residents and faculty, ensuring timely feedback and documentation.
Coordinate educational activities across both hospital sites to ensure consistency and quality of training.
Engagement in scholarly activities.
Facilitate faculty development and engagement in the educational mission.
Promote a culture of professionalism, wellness, and inclusivity within the residency program.
Support and encourage resident involvement in scholarly activity and research.
Maintain program accreditation through compliance with institutional and ACGME policies.
Lead the Clinical Competency Committee (CCC) and guide the Program Evaluation Committee (PEC).
ACCOUNTABILITIES
Ensuring the residency program remains in good standing with the ACGME and Advocate’s GME office.
Maintaining accurate and up-to-date program documentation, including resident files, evaluations, and curricular materials.
Addressing resident concerns and performance issues in a timely and constructive manner.
Reporting program outcomes and improvement initiatives to institutional leadership.
Ensuring equitable and adequate clinical exposure and operative experience for all residents.
Upholding ethical standards and fostering a safe, respectful learning environment.
Monitoring and managing program resources, including faculty time and educational budgets, as applicable.
ADDITIONAL HIGHLIGHTS
Be part of an integrated nationally recognized organization with physician-led medical group and embedded service line
Leverage access to DAX Copilot, an AI-powered clinical documentation tool integrated with Epic, streamlining clinical workflows by generating draft patient notes for efficient review, editing, and signature
Experience an environment that provides safe and equitable care for all patients
Training and/or Experience Required
Completion of an accredited general surgery residency program and trauma/surgical critical care
Board certified with a  minimum of 5 years of clinical experience in addition to at least 3 years in a core faculty or other GME leadership role
Excellent skills in leadership, team building and collaboration are required

Flexible spending accounts for eligible health care and dependent care expenses

As the third-largest city in the U.S., it offers the perfect blend of urban energy and community charm. Whether you're strolling along the lakefront, exploring iconic museums, or enjoying deep-dish pizza in a local neighborhood, there's always something new to discover. Chicago's food scene is world-renowned, its arts and entertainment options are endless, and sports fans can cheer for legendary teams year-round. The city boasts miles of parks and trails, scenic beaches, and year-round festivals. From historic architecture to a thriving music scene and an ever-evolving culinary landscape, Chicago brings together tradition and innovation in one dynamic place. description_text:

Franklin, Wisconsin

Description & Requirements
Join one of the nation’s largest, most respected health systems and experience what it means to live well. Advocate Health is seeking a Family medicine physician to join our physician-led medical group and serve its patients at Aurora Health Center - Franklin West in Franklin, WI.
Highlights
Franklin West – Internal Medicine
Reason for opening – resignation
The patient panel be a mix of inherited panel plus a start up
There will be 3 family physicians in Suite 116 and 3 internal medicine physicians in Suite 101
Suite is open 6:45 – 6:00 PM Mondays, 6:45 – 5:00 Tues – Friday. Our physicians are asked to work 100 hours extended hours per year. This is done before 8 am, after 5 pm or during the 12-1 lunch hour.
The call is managed by the nurse triage line where 85% of the calls are resolved without involving the physician on call.
What are the specialties at the site? Cardiology, Pediatrics, OBGYN, GI, Diabetic Education, Podiatry, Anticoagulation, Physical Therapy, Urgent Care, ACL Lab, Imaging, Aurora Pharmacy, Optometry,
What equipment do you have on site?  Lab, x-ray (In building).  We have Clinteck and A1C machines in suite 101. The labs are sent out daily for blood draws, cultures, and swabs.
Each physician has their own office and 3 exam rooms per physician They can also do procedures
The support structure includes each physician having their own MA and we have 3 Shared RN’s for Site (covering 7 physicians for Triage, Medicare Wellness, Anticoagulation, Emergency Response, Education)
What does the patient demographic look like? We see patients 0 – end of life, all ethnicities, With Commercial, Government, and Medicaid insurance
How is the team dynamic?  Do they collaborate with each other?  Open door policy?  Socialize at work or outside work? The team collaborates, and discusses coverage, and issues with each other.
Training and/or Experience Required
New and experienced clinicians welcome to apply

Paid Time Off programs for eligible positions

Family benefits such as parental leave, adoption assistance and surrogacy assistance

CME allowance

About Oshkosh, Wisconsin

Home to the University of Wisconsin-Oshkosh, the city buzzes with energy and innovation, while maintaining a relaxed, family-friendly atmosphere. Outdoor enthusiasts will love the year-round recreational boating, fishing, biking, and snowshoeing are just the beginning. Short commutes, excellent schools, and safe neighborhoods make it an ideal place to put down roots. Plus, with easy access to Milwaukee, Green Bay, and the Fox Cities, adventure is never far away. Whether you're looking to grow your career or settle into a welcoming community, Oshkosh delivers the best of both worlds.

The Section of General Academic Pediatrics and Adolescent Medicine at Wake Forest University School of Medicine is seeking a collaborative, visionary physician leader to serve as Section Head. comprises
:

5 advanced practice providers (APPs)
A mental health professional

Faculty members are highly productive and engaged in a broad range of scholarly activities, including research, education, quality improvement, and advocacy. Many also hold national leadership roles in organizations such as the American Academy of Pediatrics (AAP), the North Carolina AAP chapter, and the Academic Pediatric Association (APA).

Clinical Services
Our General Pediatrics team provides care in a community-based primary care clinic,
designated
as a patient-centered medical home, serving an under-resourced population. This clinic is also the primary teaching site for our pediatric residency program.

roles

a state-of-the-art

e
ating disorders
, a
dolescent gynecology

ental health

ubstance use disorders

expertise

description_text:

Description & Requirements
Are you a dedicated and innovative Family Medicine Physician eager to shape the future of patient care? Join our team in delivering high-quality, patient-centered care through our cutting-edge Primary Care Model.
This innovative approach blends the best of in-person care with the convenience of virtual visits—not to replace face-to-face interactions, but to enhance access, improve continuity, and offer patients greater flexibility for follow-ups, routine check-ins, and chronic disease management. This site is designed to support polychronic patients with complex medical needs, making chronic care coordination a central focus. Providers will work alongside an integrated care team that includes behavioral health specialists, PharmDs, physical therapists, and other support services—all onsite to support whole-person care.
In this pivotal role, you'll provide comprehensive medical care, skillfully balancing virtual consultations with in-person visits. This is not about replacing face-to-face interactions; it's about expanding options for patients, ensuring they receive flexible, effective, and continuous healthcare, meeting patients where they are.
Highlights
Outpatient only - 36 clinic hours per week
EPIC EMR
24/7 Nurse triage support
Be part of an integrated, nationally recognized organization with a physician-led medical group and embedded service line
Leverage access to DAX Copilot, an AI-powered clinical documentation tool integrated with Epic, streamlining clinical workflows by generating draft patient notes for efficient review, editing, and signature
Experience an environment that provides safe and equitable care for all patients
2-year guarantee of $301,319
Sign on bonus, student loan forgiveness

Board-certified in Family Medicine.

About Chicago, Illinois
Located 14 miles south of the Chicago loop, this south side neighborhood is famous for incredible architecture, vast green spaces and a strong Irish heritage.
The neighborhood's shamrock influence prevails on the pub-lined streets of Western Avenue's ethnic business corridor, where there are more Irish-style bars than in any other neighborhood in Chicago. As the home of Chicago's South Side Irish Parade, the Emerald Isle is almost palpable. Beverly's most striking building, The Beverly Unitarian Church, borrows its design from a medieval castle once situated between Dublin and Belfast. The Beverly Arts Center, an epicenter for local culture, features a professional theater series and presents live music performances by nationally recognized acts.
Beverly also boasts one of the country's largest historical districts, complete with trademark homes designed by Frank Lloyd Wright and his contemporaries. The area's shopping pocket along 103rd Street showcases the area's intimate and unique shopping district, which includes Heritage Gallery and Calabria Imports. Further north, you will find the original Rainbow Cone, a city institution that's been serving up ice cream for more than 80 years. For those of you with an especially demanding sweet tooth, Jimmy Jamms Sweet Potato Pies is right around the corner and offers a honey cream cheese-topped slice of nirvana.

Join Atrium Health Wake Forest Baptist's Academic Faculty as an Ophthalmology Physician in Winston- Salem, North Carolina—part of Advocate Health, one of the largest nonprofit integrated health systems in the country.
At Advocate Health, we’re committed to being a Best Place to Care—where physicians are empowered, heard, and equipped to do their best work. Whether you're seeking professional growth, meaningful impact, or a team that lifts you up—this is where it starts.
Highlights
Department Description:
At the Department of Ophthalmology at the Wake Forest School of Medicine, we are training the next generation of specialists in eye care. Our department offers a robust resident training program in comprehensive ophthalmology in addition to fellowships in cornea and external disease, retina-vitreous disease, and oculofacial plastic and orbital surgery.
Education and Research
In addition to caring for patients, our ophthalmology specialists provide graduate and post-graduate medical education and clinical scientific research. We are continually evaluating specialty eye care treatments and thinking carefully and deeply about what is the best way to take care of each individual patient who walks through our doors.
Many of the vision tests, treatments and therapies offered at the Eye Center were actually pioneered by members of our team. Because of our ongoing work in clinical trials, research and innovation, we offer treatments not available everywhere.
By using new approaches such as these with the latest equipment and resources typically available at large academic medical centers, we achieve more successful outcomes in patients with common and more difficult-to-treat eye conditions.
Training and/or Experience Required

MD or MD/PhD

description_text:

academic Clinical Pathologist

. This is a unique opportunity to lead and develop a cutting-edge clinical and research program within a nationally recognized academic health system,

Salary and academic rank will be commensurate with experience and qualifications.

Provide
clinical and technical leadership
for a rapidly growing mass spectrometry program.

MD or PhD with specialized training and experience in mass spectrometry.

Proven experience in a high-volume, complex clinical laboratory environment.
A passion for advancing laboratory medicine through method development, informatics and interdisciplinary collaboration.

title: Maternal Fetal Medicine Physician - Charlotte, NC
description_text:
General Information
Location
Carolinas Medical Center
1350 S Kings Dr Charlotte, NC, United States Charlotte, North Carolina
Charlotte, North Carolina
Care Delivery Brand
Atrium Health
Description & Requirements
Join Atrium Health as a Maternal Fetal Medicine Physician in Charlotte, NC—part of Advocate Health, one of the largest nonprofit integrated health systems in the country.
At Advocate Health, we’re committed to being a Best Place to Care—where physicians are empowered, heard, and equipped to do their best work. You’ll be part of a leading integrated system with a shared commitment to innovation, well-being, and the communities we serve. Whether you're seeking professional growth, meaningful impact, or a team that lifts you up—this is where it starts.
The Department of Obstetrics & Gynecology at the
Atrium Health/Wake Forest School of Medicine
in
Charlotte, NC
is seeking a Maternal-Fetal Medicine Physician.
We are a close knit, collaborative and busy group seeking a clinically oriented physician who will practice at one or more of our clinical sites and will participate in resident and medical student education. We are faculty of the Wake Forest School of Medicine and currently host clinical students and will have a full four-year medical school campus in Charlotte in 2025. We have a growing perinatal research program and are supported by an experienced research team including a PhD investigator.
The Department offers OB/Gyn specialty and subspecialty services at several sites across Charlotte, primarily at Carolinas Medical Center, the academic medical center.  We are the safety-net hospital for greater Charlotte and receive referrals from areas across North and South Carolina and surrounding states. CMC is an 874-bed hospital and perform 6,000+ deliveries a year.  We have an 85-bed level 4 NICU with ECMO capacity and full scope of pediatric subspecialists.
Highlights
We are currently a division of 11 physicians, 4 full-time nurse practitioners, 5 genetic counselors and a large group of talented sonographers and support staff.
We offer primarily consultative care but do full-scope prenatal care in our resident clinic.
We staff a busy inpatient antepartum service and cover select labor and delivery day shifts on those weeks. Call is home-call.  We value work life balance.
Training and/or Experience Required
New graduates and experienced MFM practitioners are encouraged to apply.
Must have an MD/DO degree
Completed an ACGME accredited obstetrics and gynecology residency program
Completed an ACGME accredited maternal-fetal medicine fellowship
Academic appointment is anticipated to be at the Assistant or Associate Professor level in the Department of OB/Gyn at Wake Forest University
